meanings.definition: To make a series of soft explosive sounds
meanings.sent1: The old car engine would sputter before finally starting.
meanings.sent2: The campfire began to sputter as the wood caught fire.
meanings.sent3: The sputtering toaster made breakfast more exciting.
meanings.sent4: His anger sputtered like a damp firework, never fully igniting.
meanings.sent5: The sputter of the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: To speak in a hesitant or incoherent manner
meanings.sent1: She would sputter her lines nervously during the play.
meanings.sent2: The shy student would sputter when asked to present in class.
meanings.sent3: His sputtering explanation left everyone confused.
meanings.sent4: Her words sputtered out like a broken record.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech sputtered as he tried to avoid questions.

meanings.definition: A series of soft explosive sounds
meanings.sent1: The sudden sputter of fireworks startled the birds.
meanings.sent2: The rhythmic sputter of the rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The sputter of the old radio added to the eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The distant sputter of a motorcycle echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The sputter of the engine signaled the start of the race.

meanings.definition: A spray of small particles or liquid
meanings.sent1: The sputter of paint covered the walls in a messy pattern.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a final sputter of olive oil to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The sputter of water from the fountain created a refreshing mist.
meanings.sent4: The sputter of sparks flew from the welding torch.
meanings.sent5: The sputter of bubbles rose to the surface of the boiling pot.
